Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.impl

Class Text

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.VisibleObject
      • us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.impl.Text
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable
    public class Text
extends VisibleObject
    Draws a text message on the drawing surface. The text color is controlled by the fill color. If a border is desired around the text, set the line color to a color. If the line color is set to null no border will be drawn around the text.

    Note that unlike most drawing object, the text location's Y coordinate is not the upper left corner of a box containing the text. Instead it represents the Y location of the text baseline, which is the bottom of most characters (those without descenders - e.g. lowercase b and h have no descenders while g and j do).

    TODO Fix mouseClickDetected() to properly calculate click based on rotation

    Author:
    readda

    • Field Detail

      • LOG

        private static final org.apache.log4j.Logger LOG
        The logger

      • newMode

        private static boolean newMode
        A kludge to deal with a change to text positioning. Originally the y location was for the text baseline. In the "new mode" the y location is consistent with other shaps and represents the top of the text area (e.g. the top based on the font metric).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Text

        public Text​(java.lang.String message,
            java.awt.Point location,
            int fontSize,
            java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Create a text message starting at the supplied location's X pixel location and it's base line at the supplied Y pixel location. THIS POSITIONING DIFFERS FROM OTHER GRAPHIC OUTPUT since the Y location is not the upper left-hand corner. See documentation on Java's Font implementation to learn about FontMetrics, base lines, ascents and such that impact text positioning. The text will be drawn using the supplied font size and fill color.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be shown
        location - The left-hand pixel location for the start of the text. The left-hand baseline Y pixel location (e.g. this is NOT the upper left-hand Y location of the text).
        fontSize - The point size of the font
        fillColor - The color of the text
        See Also:
        FontMetrics

      • Text

        public Text​(java.lang.String message,
            java.awt.Point location,
            int fontSize,
            java.awt.Color borderColor,
            java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Create a text message starting at the supplied location's X pixel location and it's base line at the supplied Y pixel location. THIS POSITIONING DIFFERS FROM OTHER GRAPHIC OUTPUT since the Y location is not the upper left-hand corner. See documentation on Java's Font implementation to learn about FontMetrics, base lines, ascents and such that impact text positioning. The text will be drawn using the supplied font size and fill color. If the border color is not null, a box will be drawn around the text using that color.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be shown
        location - The left-hand pixel location for the start of the text. The left-hand baseline Y pixel location (e.g. this is NOT the upper left-hand Y location of the text).
        fontSize - The point size of the font
        borderColor - The color of the enclosing box surrounding the text. This may be null if no enclosing box is desired.
        fillColor - The color of the text
        See Also:
        FontMetrics

      • Text

        public Text​(java.lang.String message,
            java.awt.Point location,
            int fontSize,
            int rotationDegrees,
            java.awt.Color borderColor,
            java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Create a text message starting at the supplied X pixel location and it's base line at the supplied Y pixel location. THIS POSITIONING DIFFERS FROM OTHER GRAPHIC OUTPUT since the Y location is not the upper left-hand corner. See documentation on Java's Font implementation to learn about FontMetrics, base lines, ascents and such that impact text positioning. The text will be drawn using the supplied font size and fill color. If the border color is not null, a box will be drawn around the text using that color. The text will be rotated based on the rotation value.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be shown
        location - The left-hand pixel location for the start of the text. The left-hand baseline Y pixel location (e.g. this is NOT the upper left-hand Y location of the text).
        fontSize - The point size of the font
        rotationDegrees - The number of degrees clockwise (with 0 being unrotated) that the line should be rotated when drawn. This should be a number from 0 to 359.
        borderColor - The color of the enclosing box surrounding the text. This may be null if no enclosing box is desired.
        fillColor - The color of the text
        See Also:
        FontMetrics

      • drawText

        private void drawText​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Convert text to graphic and place on graphics context - rotating if required. This allows rotated text to be correctly rendered on Mac platform. Adapted from: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14767826/rotating-text-in-java2d-on-mac
        Parameters:
        g2 - The graphics context to update

      • mouseClickDetected

        public boolean mouseClickDetected​(int x,
                                  int y)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject
        Default implementation only matches the location pixel. Subclasses should override this to detect a click within their area.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • setNewMode

        public static final void setNewMode​(boolean newMode)
        A kludge to deal with a change to text positioning. Originally the y location was for the text baseline. In the "new mode" the y location is consistent with other shapes and represents the top of the text area (e.g. the top based on the font metric).
        Parameters:
        newMode - True if the new mode (y location is top of font) is desired.
